title: Ticket #7327: transfer_output_remaps doesn't remap implicitly-listed files
description:
test.submit
universe = vanilla
output = s3/output
error = s3/error
log = s3/log

executable = /bin/sleep
arguments = 1
transfer_executable = false

should_transfer_files = always
transfer_input_files = ../input
transfer_output_files = input
transfer_output_remaps = "input = output"

queue

The preceding submit file copies ../input to output on the submit node, but the following submit file does not. 

test2.submit
universe = vanilla
output = s3/output
error = s3/error
log = s3/log

executable = /bin/sleep
arguments = 1
transfer_executable = false

should_transfer_files = always
transfer_input_files = ../input
transfer_output_remaps = "input = output"

queue

In fact, test2.submit doesn't produce any output at all, probably because HTCondor noticed that 'input' was unchanged. However, while the following copies back the whole sandbox, it does not rename 'input' to 'output': 

test3.submit
universe = vanilla
output = s3/output
error = s3/error
log = s3/log

executable = /bin/sleep
arguments = 1
transfer_executable = false

should_transfer_files = always
transfer_input_files = ../input
transfer_output_files = .
transfer_output_remaps = "input = output"

queue

Naming 'input' in transfer_output_files causes both 'input' and 'output' to appear on the submit node: 

test4.submit
universe = vanilla
output = s3/output
error = s3/error
log = s3/log

executable = /bin/sleep
arguments = 1
transfer_executable = false

should_transfer_files = always
transfer_input_files = ../input
transfer_output_files = input, .
transfer_output_remaps = "input = output"

queue

This strongly suggests we're either applying the remaps early (before we expand dirnames) or to the wrong list (transfer_output_files rather than the dirname expanded list).

The manual says "Note that this remap function only works with files but not with directories," but that seems more like it means remapping directory 'a' to 'b' won't do anything, rather than 'you must explicitly specify all output files you want to remap'.
